hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Positive RSI Divergence on High Volume
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BEAR regime, if BTC makes a lower low over a 3-day period while its 4-hour RSI(14) makes a higher low (bullish divergence), AND the divergence candle has volume > 1.5x its 20-day average, a regime transition to NEUTRAL will occur within the next 3 days, characterized by decreased daily volatility and range-bound price action.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Momentum divergence at the end of a bear trend, especially accompanied by elevated volume, signals exhaustion of selling pressure. This often leads to a stabilization period (neutral regime) as the market digests the move and establishes a new equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h RSI(14) makes higher low vs. prior RSI low
Volume on 4h candle confirming divergence > 1.5x 20-day avg volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price drops >5% below the divergence candle's low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If less than 55% of such signals result in a NEUTRAL regime classification within 5 days, or if the average volatility in the 3 days post-signal is not lower than the 3 days pre-signal.
